sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词都含有"资料，信息"之意。
means: information和data作"资料"解时，前者仅指所获得、提供或描述的慨况，而不指具体的数据或资料，后者则指具体的资料。
data是datum的复数形式，本义指作为计算和测量基础的资料。
message ： 指通过书写、谈话和信号等方式所进行的通讯"信息"。

word_mean: (单 datum)资料，论(数)据：作讨论或参考依据的事实材料

Sentence.sentence: A further concern is that the use of electronic means of payment leaves an electronic trail that contains a large amount of personal data.
Sentence.come: 2013年考研真题（英语二）完形填空 Section Ⅰ

Sentence.sentence: After several decades, the same data were subjected to econometric analysis.
Sentence.come: 2010年考研真题（英语一）完形填空 Section Ⅰ

Sentence.sentence: Britain is setting up a data ethics center.
Sentence.come: 2020年考研真题（英语一）翻译 Section Ⅲ

Sentence.sentence: But that message did not play well with many in Iowa, where wind turbines dot the fields and provide 36 percent of the state's electricity generation – and where tech giants like Microsoft are being attracted by the availability of clean energy to power t
Sentence.come: 2018年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: But there is also a different way to look at the data.
Sentence.come: 2017年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: But this distinction misses the point that it is processing and aggregation, not the mere possession of bits, that gives the data value.
Sentence.come: 2018年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: Databases used by some companies don't rely on data collected systematically but rather lump together information from different research projects.
Sentence.come: 2009年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: Digital services include everything from providing a platform for selling goods and services online to targeting advertising based on user data, and the tax applies to gross revenue from such services.
Sentence.come: 2020年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: Further arrangements—and there may be many—between the NHS and Deep mind will be carefully scrutinized to ensure that all necessary permissions have been asked of patients and all unnecessary data has been cleaned.
Sentence.come: 2018年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: However, a comparison with data for weeks when there was no experimentation showed that output always went up on Mondays.
Sentence.come: 2010年考研真题（英语一）完形填空 Section Ⅰ

Sentence.sentence: If software promises to save lives on the scale that drugs now can, big data may be expected to behave as a big pharma has done.
Sentence.come: 2018年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: Just as some ants farm the bugs called aphids for the honeydew they produce when they feed, so Google farms us for the data that our digital lives yield.
Sentence.come: 2018年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: Just how much does the Constitution protect your digital data?
Sentence.come: 2015年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: Professional scientists are expected to know how to analyze data, but statistical errors are alarmingly common in published research, according to David Vaux, a cell biologist.
Sentence.come: 2015年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: The data of an individual there gains its value only when it is compared with the data of countless millions more.
Sentence.come: 2018年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: The great question is who should benefit from the analysis of all the data that our lives now generate.
Sentence.come: 2018年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: The policy follows similar efforts from other journals, after widespread concern that basic mistakes in data analysis are contributing to the irreproducibility of many published research findings.
Sentence.come: 2015年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: The product they're selling is data, and we, the users, convert our lives to data for the benefit of the digital giants.
Sentence.come: 2018年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: There are concerns that government, employers, and marketers might be able to access these data, thereby violating our privacy.
Sentence.come: 2013年考研真题（英语二）完形填空 Section Ⅰ

Sentence.sentence: They could still invalidate Fourth Amendment protections when facing severe, urgent circumstances, and they could take reasonable measures to ensure that phone data are not erased or altered while waiting for a warrant.
Sentence.come: 2015年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: This means that a DNA database may have a lot of data from some regions and not others, so a person's test results may differ depending on the company that processes the results.
Sentence.come: 2009年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

mean.mean: （储存在计算机中的）数据资料

entry.def: You can refer to information as data, especially when it is in the form of facts or statistics that you can analyse. In American English, data is usually a plural noun. In technical or formal British English, data is sometimes a plural noun, but at other times, it is an uncount noun.
entry.tran: （尤指可用于分析的）资料，材料，数据（美国英语中通常用作复数名词;在专业或正式的英国英语中有时用作复数名词，有时用作不可数名词)

example.ex: The study was based on data from 2,100 women...
example.tran: 这项研究基于从 2,100 名女性那里收集来的资料。

example.ex: ...the latest year for which data is available...
example.tran: 有可利用资料的最近的年份

entry.def: Data is information that can be stored and used by a computer program.
entry.tran: (可存储并为计算机程序所用的）数据

example.ex: You can compress huge amounts of data on to a CD-ROM.
example.tran: 可以把大量的数据压缩到一张CD-ROM上。

means.word_mean: 1. a collection of facts from which conclusions may be drawn;

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent. (as a term in philosophy): from Latin, plural of datum

sentences.en: Many large institutions keep this kind of data secret — or at least make it  incredibly difficult to find.
sentences.from: 15年12月六级真题（第三套）| 阅读

sentences.cn: 但是从所有这些数据中，我们感受不到今天的青少年对国家，对更广泛意义上的公民环境、政治环境抑或社会未来的强烈关心。
sentences.en: But missing from all these data is the sense that today’s young care very much about their country, about the broader civic and political environment, or about the future of their society.
sentences.from: 16年6月六级真题（第一套）| 阅读

sentences.cn: 但是，这些数据已足够精确，可让我们辨别出一个明显的趋势。
sentences.en: But the data is exact enough for a clear trend to be easily discernible.
sentences.from: 16年6月六级真题（第三套）| 阅读

sentences.cn: that today’s teens are even more stressed than adults压力出现的时间也提前了，数据显示，如今青少年的压力甚至大过成年人

sentences.from: 16年12月六级真题（第一套）| 阅读

sentences.cn: 最成功的分享者——也就是那些数据最常被下载引用的人们——会引起关注，他们的工作成果也会被使用。
sentences.en: The most successful sharers— those whose data are downloaded and cited the most often— get noticed, and their work gets used.
sentences.from: 17年6月六级真题（第一套）| 阅读

sentences.cn: 举个例子，多学科知识库Dryad 中最受欢迎的一组数据是关于世界各地木材密度的；这组数据被下载过5700 次。
sentences.en: For example, one of the most popular data sets on multidisciplinary repository Dryad is about wood density around the world; it has been downloaded 5,700 times.
sentences.from: 17年6月六级真题（第一套）| 阅读

sentences.cn: 公布数据和编码让你的知识具有了可重复性。”
sentences.en: Publishing data and code allows your science to be reproducible.”
sentences.from: 17年6月六级真题（第一套）| 阅读

sentences.cn: 就算是数据不那么受欢迎的那些研究人员也可以获益。

sentences.cn: 田纳西州客户事务政府办公室正在审查外包政策的可行性，在其发出的一份电子邮件声明中， 发言人Michelle R.Martin 说各位官员仍在分析董事会提供的数据。
sentences.en: In an email statement from the state’s Office of Customer Focused Government, which is examining the possibility of outsourcing, spokeswoman Michelle R. Martin said officials were still working to analyze the data from the Board of Regents.

sentences.cn: 大学系统或者其他州政部门管理方面的支出数据将是官员们考虑外包计划的细节时州政府将会采用的“商业论证”的一部分。

sentences.cn: 美国劳工统计局的数据显示，有 270 万曾想要求职且拥有工作能力的人在过去四周内没有再去找工作，这类人甚至已不再被归入失业人员之列。

sentences.cn: 从收集到的数据看，总体来说，导致我们失去大部分睡眠时间的似乎是体育赛事、时制更改和节假日。

sentences.cn: 这些数据肯定会使那场一直在继续的辩论愈发激烈，即当学校拼命想依靠更少的预算 (30) 继续维持运营时，是否应该削减体育课。

sentences.cn: 在10 个月间，康卡斯特公司收到了大约12,000 件顾客投诉，很多都是(32) 关于其每月数据上限和对超额部分的收费的。
